text.p: Danish wire and cable manufacturer NKT Holding A/S on Wednesday upwardly adjusted its forecast for its cable and vacuum cleaner units' full year 1996 pre-tax profit to 180 million crowns.
NKT, which posted a 94 million crown pre-tax profit in 1995, said it expected its contribution to the holding company's overall 1996 profits would almost double, rising possibly further in 1997.

The company attributed its greatly improved expectations to increased sales of cables to the building industry, reduced costs, an anticipated swing back into profit for loss-making vacuum cleaner unit Nilfisk and advances in other production units.
NKT Holding releases its 1996 results end-March 1997.
